title: PHPob_implicit_flush()Function

metadata.description: Learn about PHPob_implicit_flush()Function with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
Example
Send content immediately to the browser on every statement which produces output:
<?php
// Turn on implicit flushing
ob_implicit_flush(1);
// Some 
  browsers will not display the content if it is too short
// We use 
  str_pad() to make the output long enough
echo str_pad("Hello World!", 
  4096);
// Even though the script is still running, the browser already 
  can
  see the content
sleep(3);
?>
Definition and Usage
The
ob_implicit_flush()
function enables or disabled implicit flushing. When enabled, implicit flushing sends output directly
to the browser as soon as it is produced so that calls to the
flush()
function are not
needed.
Syntax
ob_implicit_flush(flag);
Parameter Values
Parameter
Description
flag
When set to 1, implicit flushing is turned on. When set to 0, implicit flushing is turned off.
Technical Details
PHP Version:
4+

★
+1
